Package cs3500.freecell.model

Interface FreecellModelState<K>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the Card type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FreecellModel<K>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFreecellModel, MultiFreecellModel, SimpleFreecellModel
    public interface FreecellModelState<K>
    This interface represents different operations that a freecell model must support to return various aspects of its state. This interface does not provide any operations to mutate the state of a freecell model

    • Method Detail

      • getNumCardsInFoundationPile

        int getNumCardsInFoundationPile​(int index)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get the number of cards in a given foundation pile.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the foundation pile, starting at 0
        Returns:
        the number of cards in the given foundation pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided index is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game has not started

      • getNumCascadePiles

        int getNumCascadePiles()
        Get the number of cascade piles in this game of freecell.
        Returns:
        the number of cascade piles, as an integer, or -1 if the game has not started yet

      • getFoundationCardAt

        K getFoundationCardAt​(int pileIndex,
                      int cardIndex)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get the card at the provided index in the provided foundation pile.
        Parameters:
        pileIndex - the index of the foundation pile, starting at 0
        cardIndex - the index of the card in the above foundation pile, starting at 0
        Returns:
        the card at the provided indices
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pileIndex or cardIndex is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game has not started

      • getOpenCardAt

        K getOpenCardAt​(int pileIndex)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get the card in the given open pile.
        Parameters:
        pileIndex - the index of the open pile, starting at 0
        Returns:
        the card at the provided index, or null if there is no card there
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pileIndex is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game has not started
